properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and torrential rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T10:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T02:50:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1611954461.2019
Area: Amqui area, Matapédia area, New-Richmond - Bonaventure area, Restigouche - Carleton area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:48 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-31T12:47:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T09:48:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3550235669.2019
Area: Thetford Mines area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T20:37:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T08:37:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2783308963.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will continue along with brisk northwest winds before coming to an end near midnight. This rainfall is associated with a low pressure system moving slowly northward over southeastern HUdson Bay. A total of 44.3 mm of rain was reported at Peawanuck as of 8.00 PM. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T09:54:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T01:55:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3849875027.2019
Area: Peawanuck, Fort Albany
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and humid airmass continues over Nova Scotia and will persist into Thursday. Daytime highs over inland areas of Nova Scotia are forecast to be near 30 degrees today with overnight lows near 18 degrees tonight providing little relief. Humidex values are expected to reach near 38 again today. Temperatures over northern parts of the province will begin to cool down on Thursday as a trough of low pressure moves in from the northwest. Elsewhere the warm and humid conditions will persist. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Information is provided on the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness website at https://novascotia.ca/heat-related-illness/. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T23:09:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T07:10:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1866733113.2019
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County

properties.Title: Special Marine Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A thunderstorm east of Point Pelee contains frequent lightning along with downpours suddenly reducing visibility to half a mile or less. Gusts near 30 knots, along with a waterspout are also possible. This thunderstorm is moving northeast at 10 to 15 knots and will be over the waters near and south of Rondeau near 5.00 AM. ### Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-07-31T11:59:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T06:57:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0462126704.2019
Area: Western Lake Erie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and humid airmass will remain over New Brunswick today. Maximum temperatures near 30 degrees will persist over New Brunswick today, with lows tonight near 18 degrees providing little relief. Humidex values of 37 to 39 will also persist. Maximum temperatures along the Bay of Fundy, will be somewhat cooler. However, areas slightly inland are still likely to reach heat warning criteria. Temperatures will cool somewhat on Thursday as a trough of low pressure moves across the region. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T23:08:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T07:09:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3024185703.2019
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Oromocto and Sunbury County, Grand Lake and Queens County, Sussex - Kennebecasis Valley and Kings County, Saint John and County, St. Stephen and Northern Charlotte County, Grand Manan and Coastal Charlotte County, Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Kent County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Kouchibouguac National Park, Fundy National Park, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway, Bathurst and Chaleur Region, Miramichi and area, Acadian Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:16 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, pea to dime size hail and torrential rain. A series of thunderstorms are moving along a line just north of Humboldt running approximately from Bruno to Spalding. Rainfall totals from these thunderstorms will exceed 50 mm with some locations receiving 75 to 100 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-31T11:45:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T09:17:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1591884008.2019
Area: R.M. of Humboldt including Humboldt Carmel and Fulda, R.M. of St Peter including Muenster and Lake Lenore, R.M. of Spalding including Spalding, R.M. of Ponass Lake including Rose Valley Fosston and Nora
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and humid airmass will remain over Prince Edward Island today. Maximum temperatures are expected to reach 30 degrees again today. Overnight lows tonight are expected to fall to near 19 degrees providing little relief from the heat. Humidex values near 38 are expected again today. Temperatures across the island will cool somewhat on Thursday as a trough of low pressure moves in from the northwest. Daytime highs on Thursday are forecast to be around 24 degrees with humidex values near 30. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T23:10:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T07:11:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0621842793.2019
Area: Kings County P.E.I., Queens County P.E.I., Prince County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A low pressure trough will push eastward across Saskatchewan tonight and Wednesday. As the trough moves through it will continue to trigger thunderstorms, some of which will likely become severe throughout the night as it encounters the warm, humid, and unstable airmass already in place. The severe thunderstorm watch has ended for Regina as well as points west and south, but has been expanded to include regions from Moosomin through Kamsack. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-31T13:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-31T03:20:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3460487630.2019
